dblp.social.hibernate
Interface ISodaHibernateSession

All Known Implementing Classes:
SodaHibernateSessionImpl
public interface ISodaHibernateSession

Persistence providers have to provide an implementation of this interface. Like this, we provide a common interface for future persistence solutions such as ontologies or other o/r-mappers.

Author:
ghezzi

Method Detail

open

void open()
          throws SodaHibernateException
Opens the session.

Throws:
SodaHibernateException - if session is already open.

isOpen

boolean isOpen()
Checks whether the session is open or not.

Returns:
true, if session is open. false, otherwhise.

close

void close()
           throws SodaHibernateException
Closes the session after making pending changes persistent.

Throws:
SodaHibernateException - if session is not open.

flush

void flush()
           throws SodaHibernateException
Flushes the session.

Throws:
SodaHibernateException - if session is not open.

           throws SodaHibernateException
Clears the session.

Throws:
SodaHibernateException - if session is not open.

java.util.List query(java.lang.String hqlQuery)
                     throws SodaHibernateException
Deprecated. use query(String, Class) instead

Executes a hql query and returns the results.

Parameters:
hqlQuery - the query string.
Returns:
a list of objects that match the query
Throws:
SodaHibernateException - if session is not open

query

<T> java.util.List<T> query(java.lang.String hqlQuery,
                            java.lang.Class<T> type)

Type Parameters:

Parameters:
hqlQuery - the query string.
Returns:
a list of objects of the type T that match the query

startTransaction

void startTransaction()
                      throws SodaHibernateException
Starts a transaction. Only one transaction per session can be active at any given time.

Throws:
SodaHibernateException - if session is not open or transaction already active.

endTransaction

void endTransaction()
                    throws SodaHibernateException
Commits the transaction.

Throws:
SodaHibernateException - if session is not open or no transaction is active

rollbackTransaction

void rollbackTransaction()
                         throws SodaHibernateException
Rollbacks the transaction.

Throws:
SodaHibernateException - if session is not open or no transaction is active

createSchema

void createSchema()
                  throws SodaHibernateException
Creates the database schema based on the o/r mappings (e.g. the Hibernate/ejb3-annotations). Can only be executed when session is closed.

Throws:
SodaHibernateException - if session IS active.

updateSchema

void updateSchema()
                  throws SodaHibernateException
Updates a database schema based on the o/r mappings (e.g. the Hibernate/ejb3-annotations). Can only be executed when session is closed.

Throws:
SodaHibernateException - if session IS active.

dropSchema

void dropSchema()
                throws SodaHibernateException
Drops the database schema. Can only be executed when session is closed.

Throws:
SodaHibernateException - if session IS active.

uniqueResult

java.lang.Object uniqueResult(java.lang.String hqlQuery)
                              throws SodaHibernateException
Deprecated. Use uniqueResult(String, Class) instead.

Convenience method that can be used whenever a hql-query is intended to return only one result.

Parameters:
hqlQuery - the query string
Returns:
the result
Throws:
SodaHibernateException - if session is not open or more than one result was found.

               throws SodaHibernateException

Type Parameters:
T - The type of the result
Parameters:
hqlQuery -
Returns:
the result
Throws:
SodaHibernateException - if session is not open or more than one result was found.

            throws SodaHibernateException
Updates the object.

Parameters:

Throws:
SodaHibernateException - if session is not open.

merge

java.lang.Object merge(java.lang.Object object)
                       throws SodaHibernateException
Merges the object. Useful during batch-processing where regular flushing/clearing is necessary due to memory restrictions. If e.g. saveOrUpdate(Object) is invoked instead (at least while using Hibernate), we often experience exceptions.

Parameters:
saveableObject - an instance of a Hibernate/ejb3-annotated class.
Throws:
SodaHibernateException - if session is not open.
